See embedded comments...
BTW: This should really be on the Ant user list, not the JUnit list ;)

    > 	<target name="test" depends="compile.tests,run.mail.server"
    > if="junit.present" 
    > 		description="Runs the JUnit test cases">
    > ...
    > 
    > When I run Ant, without the mail server running, it 
    > displays my error
    > output that
    > indicates that the connection to the server failed, bu 
    > then it continues
    > on. What
    > do I need to do, to cause the build to stop, if the check fails?

'haltonfailure=yes' and/or 'haltonerror=yes' should work here.

    > Also, can anyone give me some ideas as to how to kick off the mail
    > server? It is
    > a Java app. I guess I could do a <java ...> line, but how 
    > do I make that
    > conditional?
    > Is there a way to set some "property", as a result of the 
    > "dixiecheck",
    > such that
    > this app would be invoked based on that "property" or "condition"?

does <dixiecheck/> startup DixieMail if it is not running?  If so, make the
server a singleton and "away you go."

-Jason
